result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Loveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer - IMPOSED AND STAYED. Defendant entitled to 37 days credit if revoked. AMENDED 7/29/15 - SHALL RECEIVE 22 DAYS PRESENTENCE CREDIT SHOULD SUPERVISION BE REVOKED

Defendant entitled to 37 days presentence credit if revoked. AMENDED 10/1/15 - TERM OF SUPERVISION SHALL BE 2 YEARS

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:46) Defendant Brian L. Loveland in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (will appoint).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests cash bond, believes Def. is homeless; Atty. Vollan response - Def. has a number of medical issues, has surgery set for later this month; Def. address is c/o friend at 404 N. 6th Street, Wttn 53098; Prelim requested within time limits (20 days). Prelim set 1/22/15 at 10:00am in Br. 3; Court sets $500.00 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
